The abortion debate is one I've always preferred to steer clear of because of it devisiveness and the sensative nature of the debate. Personally, I am oppossed to abortion but I can see how some people might see it as the right option for them, especially in cases involving rape.

So up until recently my attitude was that they might as well legalise it here and save all those women travelling. 
 
 But then it occured to me that Ireland has one of the highest birth rates in Europe (and the aging population crisis facing Europe is one of my key economic concerns) and I wondered if the higher birth rate has something to do with the illegality of abortion. Regardless of whether or not it does, I have decided that not only am I personally against abortion, but I am firmly against it because we need the workers.
 
 P.S. I am a Catholic (by upbringing and education) turned Atheist turned Agnostic who's personal views about abortion have nothing to do with religion.
